name: Control hand signals for use by traffic officers
purpose: To direct traffic in areas where there is high traffic congestion, at the scene of an accident or the normal traffic signals are not operational.
action:
Driver must focus on the signals given by the officer, and strictly adhere to the signal given.
 The traffic officer signals takes precedence over any other traffic signal.

name: Stop traffic approaching from the front
action: Approach cautiously, look carefully and be able to stop if cross-traffic requires it.

name: Stop
purpose: Stop traffic approaching from the rear
action: Approach cautiously, look carefully and be able to stop if cross-traffic requires it.

name: Stop
purpose: Stop traffic approaching from the front and rear
action: Approach cautiously, look carefully and be able to stop if cross-traffic requires it.

name: Proceed
purpose: Indicates to the driver that he/she may proceed
action: Approach cautiously, look carefully and be able to stop if cross-traffic requires it.

name: Proceed flag signal
purpose: To direct traffic in areas where there is road works ahead, herdsman leading cattle or other animals across or next to a roadway.

name: Stop flag signal
purpose: To direct traffic in areas where there is road works ahead, herdsman leading cattle or other animals across or next to a roadway.

name: Warning flag signal
purpose: Warns a road user to proceed slowly and be alert.
